page.title: 09TEACHERS' DISPUTE, RUGELEY
page.content: The national teachers' dispute in 1984/85 was caused mainly by a low pay offer following low pay rises in recent years and by the proposed inclusion of voluntary activities in teachers' employment contracts. The teachers take their own lessons but do not cover for absent colleagues; as a result pupils have been sent home for half a day 2-3 times a term. Teachers do not supervise school meals or breaks and leave the premises to avoid accepting responsibility for pupils' activities. Many out of school clubs and sports have ceased. The dispute is not total, younger pupils are little affected and field trips are still held. Teachers are losing respect, some pupils have become militant and have left classes. Dinner and break supervision may soon resume in anticipation of settlement.
